value.title: Is It Ethical To Use Robots In War? What Are The Risks Associated With It?
value.excerpt: The use of robots in combat has always raised the ‘ethics’ question. This post tries to answer it by taking a detailed look at the pros and cons of using robots in wars.

value.title: AI gone wrong? Chess robot breaks child's finger at Russia tournament
value.excerpt: The boy, Christopher, is one of the top 30 young chess players in Moscow, Russia. During a tournament in Moscow, a chess-playing robot fractured a 7-year-old boy's finger when the youngster attempted a quick move without giving the device enough time to finish its task.

value.excerpt: NASCAR’s Next Gen car features a lot of new tech. The testing of that car also featured new ways of testing that included crash testing with not only crash test dummies, but AI and robotics as well.

value.title: Scientists combine robotics with biology to construct biohybrid microrobots
value.excerpt: A team of scientists in the Physical Intelligence Department at the Max Planck Institute for Intelligent Systems have combined robotics with biology by equipping E. coli bacteria with artificial components to construct biohybrid microrobots.

value.title: Are We Getting The Best Out Of Our Bots? Co-Intelligence Between Robots & Humans
value.excerpt: When inflation is soaring, utility bills are hitting record heights and job vacancies far outstrip the number of people seeking work, it’s tempting to see technology as the solution. But after over two years of reduced human contact are we starting to see a thirst for human contact?

value.title: Robotic Arms Allow Partially Paralyzed Man To Feed Himself
value.excerpt: Thanks to the work of scientists at Johns Hopkins University, a partially paralyzed man was able to feed himself for the first time in thirty years using just his mind and a pair of robotic arms.
